Description: Two textile fragments of undyed linen cloth (mummy-wrapping?) A is the main cloth, and B is a fragment of another textile that was found wrapped within A. A=irregular fragment of fine, open weave linen cloth. Across one end is a starting border consisting of an outer cord with warp threads looped round it in groups; worn. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.30 ends per 10mm and weft c.19 picks per 10mm. B= small, ragged fragment of linen cloth; medium-fine quality. Surface of weave looks as though it might have been flattened or polished in some way. Edges torn or ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.23 ends per 10mm and weft c.17 picks per 10mm.
